    • Constructor Detail

      • Driver.CANDevice.CANController

        private Driver.CANDevice.CANController(byte inputListIndex)
        Private constructor, can only be called from inside the class. It initializes internal variables and objects. When used with API_ADK, it is created automatically at the creation of API_ADK.Device.Controller object.
        Parameters:
        inputListIndex - Input: The listIndex of Driver.intDeviceList value.

    • Method Detail

      • connectController

        public ReturnCode connectController()
        Open a connection to the controller. For CANblue or CANblue II, do nothing since the connection to the device is the same as the controller. This is the beginning of the initialization sequence, after this method call directlyinitializeControllerBaudrate(int) or initializeControllerBaudrate(), initializeReceiveFilter(byte), and read the controller status readStatus(API.ADK.CANInfo) to fill the controllerStatus of Driver.intDeviceList automatically. The sequence can only be called once.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_INITIALIZED, or ReturnCode.SUCCESS.

      • disconnectController

        public ReturnCode disconnectController()
        Close a connection from a controller. Can not close the connection if any message channel is still using the controller.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS or ReturnCode.MESSAGE_CHANNEL_STILL_USING_CONTROLLER.

      • initializeControllerBaudrate

        public ReturnCode initializeControllerBaudrate(int baudrate)
        Initialize the baudrate manually with the high Bus Coupling.
        Parameters:
        baudrate - Input: The value of baudrate (10 - 1000).
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.FAIL_SEARCHING_STRING, ReturnCode.STRING_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_CONVERTING_TO_ARRAY, ReturnCode.FAIL_WRITING_TO_BLUETOOTH, ReturnCode.INVALID_RESPONSE, ReturnCode.INVALID_BAUDRATE_VALUE, ReturnCode.INVALID_BUS_COUPLING, ReturnCode.BAUDRATE_NOT_SUPPORTED, ReturnCode.FAIL_INITIALIZING_CONTROLLER, ReturnCode.BUS_COUPLING_NOT_SUPPORTED, ReturnCode.WAITING_FOR_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD, or ReturnCode.NO_RESPONSE.

      • initializeControllerBaudrate

        public ReturnCode initializeControllerBaudrate()
        Determine the baudrate of the CAN network with the high Bus Coupling (and 5s for each supported baudrate) and use it as the baudrate of the controller.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.STRING_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_CONVERTING_TO_ARRAY, ReturnCode.FAIL_WRITING_TO_BLUETOOTH, ReturnCode.FAIL_SEARCHING_STRING, ReturnCode.INVALID_RESPONSE, ReturnCode.INVALID_TIMEOUT_VALUE, ReturnCode.INVALID_BUS_COUPLING, ReturnCode.NO_BAUDRATE_DETECTED, ReturnCode.BUS_COUPLING_NOT_SUPPORTED, ReturnCode.WAITING_FOR_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD, or ReturnCode.NO_RESPONSE.

      • initializeReceiveFilter

        public ReturnCode initializeReceiveFilter(byte receiveFilterType)
        Use the device default setting to clear and disable the receive filter of the device, and set the active filter list (Hardware or Software filter).
        Parameters:
        receiveFilterType - Input: The value of frame format (ConstantList.HARDWARE_FILTER, or ConstantList.SOFTWARE_FILTER).
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED ReturnCode.INVALID_FILTER_TYPE, or ReturnCode.FAIL_USING_SETTINGS_DEFAULT.

      • readStatus

        public ReturnCode readStatus(CANInfo status)
        Read the status of the Controller. Call Driver.CANDevice.readErrorStatus(API.ADK.ErrorBuffer) instead.
        Parameters:
        status - Output: The status of the CAN controller.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.STRING_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_CONVERTING_TO_ARRAY, ReturnCode.FAIL_WRITING_TO_BLUETOOTH, ReturnCode.FAIL_SEARCHING_STRING, ReturnCode.INVALID_RESPONSE, ReturnCode.WAITING_FOR_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD, or ReturnCode.NO_RESPONSE.

      • enableListenMode

        public ReturnCode enableListenMode(byte mode)
        Enable or disable the listen mode of the CAN controller. The enabled listen mode supports both ASCII and binary.
        Parameters:
        mode - Input: The value of mode (ConstantList.SEND_FRAME_OFF, ConstantList.SEND_FRAME_ASCII, or ConstantList.SEND_FRAME_BINARY).
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.STRING_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_CONVERTING_TO_ARRAY, ReturnCode.FAIL_WRITING_TO_BLUETOOTH, ReturnCode.FAIL_SEARCHING_STRING, ReturnCode.INVALID_RESPONSE, ReturnCode.COMMAND_NOT_SUPPORTED, ReturnCode.INVALID_INPUT_MODE, ReturnCode.WAITING_FOR_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD, or ReturnCode.NO_RESPONSE.

      • startCANController

        public ReturnCode startCANController()
        Start the CAN Controller.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.STRING_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_CONVERTING_TO_ARRAY, ReturnCode.FAIL_WRITING_TO_BLUETOOTH, ReturnCode.FAIL_SEARCHING_STRING, ReturnCode.INVALID_RESPONSE, ReturnCode.FAIL_STARTING_CONTROLLER, ReturnCode.WAITING_FOR_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD, or ReturnCode.NO_RESPONSE.

      • stopCANController

        public ReturnCode stopCANController()
        Stop the CAN Controller.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.STRING_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_CONVERTING_TO_ARRAY, ReturnCode.FAIL_WRITING_TO_BLUETOOTH, ReturnCode.FAIL_SEARCHING_STRING, ReturnCode.INVALID_RESPONSE, ReturnCode.FAIL_STOPPING_CONTROLLER, ReturnCode.WAITING_FOR_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD, or ReturnCode.NO_RESPONSE.

      • transmitMessage

        public ReturnCode transmitMessage(MessageStructure message,
                         byte messageFormat)
        Transmit a message to the controller. There are 2 message formats, ASCII and binary. Binary format is shorter than the ASCII format, so it takes less time and increase data rate. This method is optimized for fast and repetitive sending message for more than 1 message in the interval of 5ms. Note that sending any message will change the receive message format to the same format as the sending message. Read the error status to check whether there is an error in sending the message.
        Parameters:
        message - Input: Message to be sent.
        messageFormat - Input: (ConstantList.ASCII_FORMAT, or ConstantList.BINARY_FORMAT)
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.INVALID_MESSAGE_FORMAT, ReturnCode.INVALID_MESSAGE_ID_VALUE, ReturnCode.INVALID_FRAME_FORMAT_VALUE, ReturnCode.INVALID_DATA_LENGTH, ReturnCode.INVALID_DATA_VALUE, ReturnCode.INVALID_FRAME_TYPE_VALUE, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SEMAPHORE_ACQUIRE, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SEMAPHORE_RELEASE, ReturnCode.WAITING_TO_SEND_TIMEOUT, or ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD.
